paragraphs.en: 真正重點就是 這些圖形都是相對的 你可以看到這個二十面體 可以如何變成十二面體 他們兩個之間合併的非常的好

paragraphs.zh-tw: So, the whole concept of branes in the universe, if the universe is shaped like a dodecahedron this is a very good map of what could possibly be. And that is, of course, what we are here to talk about.
paragraphs.en: 所以 宇宙外層的概念就是 假設宇宙是一個十二面體 這張圖完整的展示了他可能會變成的樣子 當然 這就是我們準備要談論的問題

paragraphs.en: 這是賽納裏昂 他們居然讓小孩子那樣漂浮著 （笑）

paragraphs.zh-tw: Man. I don't really need to comment on this. But I didn't know that Isaac Newton was in the Moody Blues. Did you? When did this happen? It's a different kind of course. And they've got five apples? I mean these guys are extrapolating in realms that are not necessarily valid.
paragraphs.en: 唉，我不想評論什麽 但是我居然不知道牛頓是不是穆迪.布魯斯樂隊的（意指心情不好）你們知道嗎 （笑） 這是什麽時候的事啊？ （笑） 當然類型不同。他們有5個蘋果嗎 我指的是這些人在鑽研科技的時候 都沒有邏輯性

paragraphs.zh-tw: Although five is a good number, of course. Ecuador, my friend Kepler, as you can see, they call him Juan.
paragraphs.en: 盡管5這個數字不錯 厄瓜多爾，我朋友開普勒 你能清楚地發現，被他們叫做萬 （笑）

paragraphs.zh-tw: Juan? No! Johannes, not Juan. It wasn't Carlos Chaplain. It's wrong.
paragraphs.en: 萬? 錯了，是約翰不是什麽萬 這不是卡洛斯牧師，搞什麽飛機啊 （笑）

paragraphs.zh-tw: René Descartes, of course. Once again these Grenada people, this is like way too sick for anybody's imagination. He's all murky. There is little kids leaning on his leg, little ghosts flying around. We gotta clean this stuff up fast, ladies and gentlemen.
paragraphs.en: 勒內.笛卡爾，又來了 這次是格林納達人，這個方法太可怕了 令人難以想象 他看上去狠難過，他腿上居然還有個小孩倚在那裏 幽靈在周圍飄舞 我想我們還是別看了 （笑）

paragraphs.zh-tw: This is, of course, the Cartesian coordinates. Once again, that's Sierra Leone.
paragraphs.en: 這是笛卡爾坐標 又是薩拉.裏昂

paragraphs.zh-tw: This is again, indicating how numbers relate to space relate to form, maps of the universe. Because that's why we're here, really, I think to figure stuff out and to love each other.
paragraphs.en: 這一次又顯示了 數字和空間，空間和宇宙，還有圖示之間的關系 這就是我們聚在這裏的原因，我們搞清楚問題的真相，英雄相惜

paragraphs.zh-tw: Descartes. Before the horse.
paragraphs.en: 笛卡爾 在馬的前面

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now, Monaco took Descartes, and just flipped him around. Now, Monaco is problematic for me, and I'll show you why.
paragraphs.en: 那麽現在摩納哥取代了笛卡爾，推翻了他的理論 其實說起來摩納哥和我還有點瓜葛，我馬上會告訴你原因

paragraphs.zh-tw: Here is a map. All they have is a casino on it. And why Franklin Delano Roosevelt is on their map I don't even want to hazard a guess.
paragraphs.en: 從這張地圖上我們可以看到，上面只有一個賭場 （笑） 爲什麽羅斯福總統會在這張郵票上呢 我不想去猜測

paragraphs.zh-tw: But I'd say he'd been to Hellespointica Depressio recently. This is the flag of Monaco. Ladies and gentlemen, the flag of Indonesia. Please examine.
paragraphs.en: 但是我說過他最近去了海裏斯龐提卡.迪普瑞斯（意爲凹陷） （笑） 大家看，這是摩納哥的國旗 這面是印尼的國旗。請比較 （笑） （鼓掌）

paragraphs.zh-tw: Not sure how this came to be, but it's not right. In Monaco, "No, what are you talking about? They are so different.
paragraphs.en: 不知道爲什麽會這樣，但是這樣肯定不對 在摩納哥，人們會說，“你說什麽呢， 它們是不一樣的”

paragraphs.zh-tw: Look, ours is more red, it's longer. They stole our flag! They stole our flag!" Bode's law wasn't even his law. It was a guy named Titus.
paragraphs.en: 看，我們的旗更紅，更長 他們偷了我們的國旗！是他們偷了我們的國旗！ （笑） 彼得定律不是他首創的，而是一個叫提图的人提出的。

paragraphs.zh-tw: And the reason I just bring this up because it is a law that doesn't really work. That's Jude Law and some of his films recently didn't work.
paragraphs.en: 我真正想說的是，這個定律一點都不管用。 而這位是裘德洛，他的六部電影確實沒有什麽票房。（Bode\'s law and Jude Law 發音聽上去有點像。暗諷Bode的定律。） （笑）

paragraphs.zh-tw: Just a correlation that indicates how things are misinterpreted. And I wonder if the photographer said, "Okay, Jude, could you touch your tooth? That's good." Just a tip, if you're being photographed for press pictures, don't touch your teeth.
paragraphs.en: 這裏只是舉了個例子向大家展示平時誤會是怎樣産生的。 我想，攝影師肯定告訴裘德洛 “嘿，jude，你可不可以用手碰著你的牙齒，像這樣，對，對。 這裏提個醒，拍照的時候可千萬別像這樣用手碰你的牙齒。 質數，高斯，我狠喜歡。 （笑）

paragraphs.zh-tw: Prime numbers, Gauss, one of my favorites. Golden section, I've been obsessed with this thing since before I was born.
paragraphs.en: 質數，高斯，我狠喜歡。 黃金分割，在我還沒出生 我就迷戀上它。

paragraphs.zh-tw: I know that scares a lot of you, but that was my purpose entirely. There we can see Fibonacci numbers related to the Golden Section, because Fibonacci and Golden Section relate to the unfolding of the measured meter of matter, as I refer to it.
paragraphs.en: 我知道這些東西都是狠多人的噩夢， 那我就達到目的了。 我們從這張圖可以看到斐波那契數列和黃金分割有關聯 我說過，因爲他們 關系到測量儀表的運作。

paragraphs.zh-tw: If Fibonacci had been on Paxil, that would be the Fibonacci series. "Ten milligram, 20 milligram." "Leonardo, dinner's ready, put down those books and take your pills." "Yes, Mama." Alright where is this going? That's a good question.
paragraphs.en: 如果斐波那契是通過吃Paxil來控制抑郁 （笑） 下面這個就是斐波那契數列了。 10毫克，20毫克... 雷昂那多，晚飯好了，別看書了把藥吃了快。 好的，媽媽 （笑） 我們現在講到哪呢？問得好

paragraphs.zh-tw: Here is the premise that I began 27 years ago. If numbers can express the laws of this incredible universe that we live, I reason, through some sort of reverse engineering, we could extrapolate from them some basic structural element of this universe.
paragraphs.en: 這是我27年前做出的假設 如果數字能表現 宇宙的規則，那麽人類所居住的環境是多麽的偉大啊。 我相信，通過一些逆向工程 我們可以從中得出 一些宇宙運行的基本規則及結構單位。

paragraphs.zh-tw: And that's what I did. Twenty-seven years ago I started working on this. And I tried to build a particle accelerator.
paragraphs.en: 這就是我在做的事情。 27年前，我開始研究這個東西 我嘗試著做一個質子加速器， （笑）

paragraphs.zh-tw: And that didn't work out well. So, then I thought a calculator is a metaphor.
paragraphs.en: 但是卻失敗了 那時，我認爲計算機是一個比喻

paragraphs.zh-tw: I can just divide numbers, that's like atom smashing. That's what I did. That's how I found Moleeds.
paragraphs.en: 我只是拆數，像原子爆炸那樣 那就是我所做的，我就是這樣發現了莫利德

paragraphs.zh-tw: Moleeds are what I believe the thing that will allow string theory to be proved. They are the nodes on the string, patterns and relationships, 27, 37.
paragraphs.en: 我相信， 弦理論可以用來證實它的作用。 他們就像是弦上的點。 模型和關系中，27，37...

paragraphs.zh-tw: That was the first chart I came up with. You can see, even if you don't go for the numbers, the beauty of the symmetry.
paragraphs.en: 這是我繪出的第一張圖 即使不喜歡數字的人也狠容易發現， 對稱的美妙

paragraphs.zh-tw: The numbers from one to 36, divided into six groups. Symmetry, pairs.
paragraphs.en: 從1到36，共6租 每2租對稱

paragraphs.zh-tw: Every top adds up to 37. Bottom, all 74.
paragraphs.en: 頂上2數相加之和是37 底部相加之和是74

paragraphs.zh-tw: There is so many intricate relationships that I'm not going to go there now, because you would say, "Hey, go back to the Fluctus part." Circle of Fifths, acoustic harmony, geometric symmetry. I knew those two were related.
paragraphs.en: 還有更多狠複雜的關系，我就不贅述 因爲你會打斷我，“你還是講講伏流克斯吧 （笑） 調音器和五度圈，聲音協調，圖像對稱 我知道它們肯定是有關系的

paragraphs.zh-tw: Once again, the Cartesian kind of cross-over. So, I said if I'm going to put a circle, see what kind of patterns I get, boom, the Red System.
paragraphs.en: 再提一下笛卡爾坐標 好，我在這裏畫這樣一個圈 看看我得到什麽樣的圖形

paragraphs.zh-tw: Look at that. You can't just make this stuff up, ladies and gentlemen. You can't just go around going, "Oh, I'm going to put some triangles in a circle and they're going to be symmetrical. And they're all going to add up, and it's going to be, oh yeah, I figured that out." This is beyond anything anybody could just make up.
paragraphs.en: 噢，我們不能這樣做 （笑） 我們不能這樣的不專業，應該認真一點。好，我在圓裏畫一個三角形 他們要互相對稱，而且要非常合理 像這樣 哦，不，不行，任何人都做不到的

paragraphs.zh-tw: There is the Orange System. And you'll see over here, these are multiples of the number 27.
paragraphs.en: 這是橙色系。你看這，這些都是27的倍數 （笑） 你看這，這些都是27的倍數

paragraphs.zh-tw: And they recapitulate that shape, even though that's a circle of nine and that's a circle of 36. It's nuts. That's the Green System. It all folds in half on the Green System, right between 18 and 19.
paragraphs.en: 他們總結出這個模式 雖然這只是9和36的倍數。簡直是亂彈琴 （笑） 這是綠色系，都是對半折的 正好在18和19之間

paragraphs.zh-tw: The Blue System. The Violet. It's all there. Look at that! I mean you cannot make that stuff up.
paragraphs.en: 然後是藍色系，紫色系，都有的 （笑） 我想說的是，這是我們做不到的 （笑）

paragraphs.zh-tw: That just doesn't fall out of a tree, ladies and gentlemen. Twenty-seven years of my life! And I'm presenting it here at TED. Why? Because this is the place if aliens land, I hope they come here.
paragraphs.en: 女士們，先生們，這可不想放棄一棵樹那麽簡單 這可是我27年來的心血。 （笑） 現在我把它在這裏展示你們，爲什麽呢 因爲如果外星人要造訪地球的話，我希望他們能到這裏來 （笑）

paragraphs.zh-tw: "We are going to destroy the Earth. Hmmm ... maybe not." In this last year I have found these subsequent systems which allow for the mathematic possibilities of the Calabi-Yau manifolds in a way that doesn't necessitate these little hidden dimensions. Which works mathematically, but it just doesn't seem God-like to me.
paragraphs.en: “我們要毀滅地球”等等，或許還是不要了 （笑） 去年，我發現你了下面的體系 考慮到多樣態流型 在數學上的可能性 這沒有使得這些隱藏的圖變得有意義 這些屬于數學範圍，我並不感興趣

paragraphs.zh-tw: It just seems like it's not sexy and elegant, it's hidden. I don't want hidden, I want to see it.
paragraphs.en: 這看上去好像不那麽迷人。我們看不到 我可不想這樣被藏著，我想看到它 （笑）

paragraphs.zh-tw: I found other pairs all have symmetry, even though, unlike the master one, their symmetry is split. Unbelievable. This is like crazy.
paragraphs.en: 我發現其它的幾對也都是對稱的 雖然不像最主要的那個一樣，這些對稱都是分開的 不可思議吧。太可怕了

paragraphs.zh-tw: Am I the only one that sees this? You know, I didn't just draw this in a day, by the way. You know, try making some charts like this at home.
paragraphs.en: 難道只有我一個人看到嗎？ （笑） 我想大家都知道，我可不是一天完成它的。 要想在家做好一些圖的話，

paragraphs.zh-tw: You gotta be accurate! There's measurement involved, increments. These are maps, by the way.
paragraphs.en: 你必須做到非常的精准！這涉及到很多單位的問題，度量增量等。 說起來，這些都可是地圖啊。

paragraphs.zh-tw: Not stamps, but one day. Okay, I'm getting to the punch. Golden Ratio, it's crazy.
paragraphs.en: 不是什麽郵票，但也可能有這樣的一天。 （笑） 繼續，下面是黃金分割。這也很巧妙。

paragraphs.zh-tw: And look at this, built within it is the Golden Ratio. I start looking at that, and look at them again.
paragraphs.en: 你看，這裏面是黃金分割。 我開始觀看，仔細地看了狠久，

paragraphs.zh-tw: They start looking like planets. I go to JPL.
paragraphs.en: 發現他們很像行星體。 我去了噴氣推進實驗室。

paragraphs.zh-tw: I look at the orbits of the planets. I find 18 examples of it in our solar system.
paragraphs.en: 然後觀察了行星的運行軌道。 我發現太遠系有18種這樣的例子。

paragraphs.zh-tw: I never told anybody. This is the first thing. This could be history. Kepler was right.
paragraphs.en: 我從沒有告訴過任何人，這是第一次，這可能成爲歷史。 （笑） 開普勒是對的。 （笑）

paragraphs.zh-tw: Eighteen and 19, the middle of the Moleeds, 0.618 is the golden section. Multiply them together, 18.618 x 19.618 is 365.247.
paragraphs.en: 18和19，莫利德的中間點。0.618，黃金分割點 把它們相乘，得到365.247

paragraphs.zh-tw: Which is .005 different from the number of days in a year. Hey, you can't make this up.
paragraphs.en: 這和一年365天僅.005的差別啊 你不能亂編啊 （笑）

paragraphs.zh-tw: Thank you very much. Thank you.
paragraphs.en: 非常感谢 （鼓掌） 謝謝 （鼓掌）

paragraphs.zh-tw: Thank you.
paragraphs.en: 謝謝大家 （鼓掌）

title: Charles Fleischer Insists All Things Are Moleeds
